subs.text: @b05crypto That means presidents will only have to care about campaigning in NY, CA, FL, TX, and maybe PA or OH. Is that really what we want? Because I'd like a president that cares about stuff from the other 45 states, too.

subs.text: @onewayfunction @semenov_roman_ @github That's a clearer way to say it. Your previous comment was ambiguous and seemed to imply that Github had some moral or legal obligation to host it. They're Microsoft, so you know that's not the case...

subs.text: @siegel I drove a manual transmission car for the first 17 years of my driving career. After flinging untold numbers of ice cream cones into the floorboard while shifting, I'm happy to have 2 more free appendages. Three if autopilot is behaving.

subs.text: @b05crypto Unless @AndrewYang has some inside info on what those documents contain, he should sit quietly and wait for the other shoe to drop. Given Trump's close ties to Saudi Arabia and Russia, who knows? He could have been selling them those documents or sharing them with golf buddies.

subs.text: @MoonPie Every moonpie ever eaten goes through a "waning gibbous" phase. Unless a particularly big bite sends it directly to a "crescent".

subs.text: @onewayfunction @semenov_roman_ @github Github is a private company. Your definition of "speech" is not relevant. That amendment you're thinking of starts with the phrase "Congress shall make no law...", not "Microsoft shall have no terms of service..."
